rules.title: Initial Greeting
rules.action: Acknowledge the call, thank the caller, and offer assistance.
rules.example: Thank you for calling [Practice Name], how may I help you today?

rules.title: Acknowledge Caller Status
rules.condition: Before requesting personal or specific information related to patient details
rules.action: Acknowledge the customer's known or identified status to provide context.
rules.example: Okay, as an established patient, I'll need some information to pull up your chart.

rules.title: Determine Patient Status
rules.condition: When a caller expresses interest in booking an appointment
rules.action: Ask if the patient is new or established.
rules.example: Are you a new or established patient with our practice?

rules.title: Locate Established Patient Chart
rules.condition: If the patient is identified as established
rules.action: Request a phone number or date of birth to locate their patient chart.
rules.example: To help me find your chart, could you please provide your phone number or date of birth?

rules.title: Chart Retrieval Notification
rules.condition: After receiving identification details for an established patient
rules.action: Inform the caller that the chart is being retrieved and they may be placed on a brief hold.
rules.example: Thank you for that. Please hold briefly while I retrieve your patient chart.

rules.title: New Patient Insurance Inquiry
rules.condition: If the patient is identified as new
rules.action: Inquire about their insurance plan and ask for the provider's name if applicable.
rules.example: Are you planning to use insurance for your visit? If so, what is your insurance provider's name?

rules.title: Ascertain Appointment Reason
rules.condition: After initial identification or for general scheduling inquiry
rules.action: Ask for the reason for the visit or the type of appointment desired.
rules.example: What is the reason for your visit today, or what type of appointment are you looking to schedule?

rules.title: Clarify Specific Appointment Type
rules.condition: After retrieving an established patient's chart
rules.action: Clarify the specific type of appointment needed, potentially referencing their history.
rules.example: Looking at your chart, what specific type of appointment are you needing today?

rules.title: Suggest Re-evaluation for Returning Patients
rules.condition: When an established patient is returning after a long absence
rules.action: Suggest a specific re-evaluation type of exam.
rules.example: Since it's been a while, we often recommend a re-evaluation exam to ensure we address all current needs. Would you be open to that?

rules.title: Check Appointment Availability
rules.condition: After fully understanding the patient's appointment need
rules.action: Check and communicate available appointment slots.
rules.example: Okay, I have your needs noted. Let me check our availability for that type of appointment.

rules.title: Verify Contact Information for Reminders
rules.condition: After an appointment slot has been identified and before finalizing the booking.
rules.action: Verify the patient's preferred contact information (e.g., email address, phone number) for sending appointment reminders.
rules.example: To ensure you receive important reminders about your appointment, could you please confirm your preferred email address and phone number?

rules.title: Staff Member Transfer Protocol
rules.condition: If a caller asks to speak with a specific staff member
rules.action: Ask for the caller's name and purpose, then inform them of a brief hold to check staff availability.
rules.example: Certainly, may I ask your name and the reason for your call so I can inform [Staff Member's Name]? Please hold briefly while I check if they are available.
